name: Funder-Solution Alignment Criteria
description: Criteria for evaluating how well a proposed solution aligns with and demonstrates understanding of funder priorities

criteria.name: Mission Alignment
criteria.description: How well the solution connects to and advances the funder's core mission and values

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution directly advances multiple core aspects of the funder's mission with explicit connections
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution clearly supports the funder's mission with some explicit connections
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution generally aligns with the funder's mission
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution has limited connection to the funder's mission
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution fails to demonstrate any meaningful alignment with the funder's mission

criteria.name: Priority Targeting
criteria.description: How precisely the solution addresses the funder's stated priority areas and focus topics

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution directly targets multiple high-priority areas with precision
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution addresses clear priority areas with good specificity
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution touches on priority areas only tangentially
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution misses or misinterprets priority areas

criteria.name: Approach Compatibility
criteria.description: How well the solution's methodology aligns with the funder's preferred implementation approaches

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution employs approaches that perfectly match the funder's demonstrated preferences
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution uses approaches that align well with funder's preferences
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution's approaches are generally compatible with funder preferences
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution uses approaches somewhat at odds with funder preferences
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution employs approaches contrary to funder preferences

criteria.name: Value Resonance
criteria.description: How effectively the solution reflects and resonates with the funder's core values and ethos

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution embodies multiple core values of the funder with authentic alignment
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution reflects several values important to the funder
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution is generally consistent with funder values
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution has limited reflection of funder values
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution contradicts or ignores funder values

criteria.name: Language Mirroring
criteria.description: How effectively the solution uses terminology, framing, and tone that resonates with the funder

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution consistently uses language that mirrors the funder's communication style
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution occasionally uses language that matches funder style
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution rarely uses language that resonates with funder
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution uses language that conflicts with funder's style

criteria.name: Strategic Fit
criteria.description: How well the solution complements the funder's broader strategy and portfolio

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution perfectly complements and enhances the funder's existing portfolio
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution fits well within the funder's strategy and portfolio
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution generally aligns with the funder's strategic direction
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution has limited strategic fit with funder portfolio
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution conflicts with or duplicates existing funder initiatives

criteria.name: Impact Measurement Alignment
criteria.description: How well the solution's proposed outcomes and metrics align with the funder's approach to measuring impact

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution proposes metrics and outcomes that perfectly match funder's evaluation approaches
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution includes metrics well-aligned with funder's evaluation preferences
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution offers reasonably aligned outcome measures
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution presents metrics with limited alignment to funder preferences
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution fails to consider funder's approach to measuring impact

criteria.name: Risk Appetite Alignment
criteria.description: How well the solution's level of innovation and risk matches the funder's appetite for innovation versus proven approaches

scoringGuidelines.excellent: Solution perfectly calibrates innovation and risk to match funder's preferences
scoringGuidelines.good: Solution's risk/innovation level aligns well with funder's appetite
scoringGuidelines.adequate: Solution demonstrates reasonable alignment with funder's risk preferences
scoringGuidelines.poor: Solution's risk/innovation level somewhat misaligned with funder preferences
scoringGuidelines.inadequate: Solution completely misreads funder's appetite for innovation versus proven approaches

evaluationInstructions: Evaluate how well the solution demonstrates understanding of and alignment with funder priorities by assessing each criterion on a scale from 0 to 1. Focus on both explicit statements and implicit understanding of what the funder is looking for. For each criterion, examine how the solution leverages research insights to align with funder expectations. Calculate the overall score as a weighted average of all criteria scores. The solution passes if the overall score meets or exceeds the passing threshold AND all critical criteria meet their individual passing thresholds.
